meanings.sent1: She had to squeeze the toothpaste tube to get the last bit out.
meanings.sent2: He likes to squeeze the stress ball when he feels anxious.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to squeeze into the tiny car with all his friends.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like it was being squeezed when she saw the puppy in the shelter.
meanings.sent5: The chef's secret to tender meat is to squeeze lemon juice over it before cooking.

meanings.sent1: The child gave her teddy bear a tight squeeze before going to bed.
meanings.sent2: He felt the warm squeeze of his grandmother's embrace.
meanings.sent3: The tree branches seemed to give each other a friendly squeeze in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The old book had a comforting smell that brought a nostalgic squeeze to her heart.
meanings.sent5: The squeeze of the handshake showed his sincerity and strength.

meanings.sent1: She had to squeeze the juice from the orange to make fresh juice.
meanings.sent2: He carefully squeezed the sponge to remove excess water.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to squeeze a rabbit out of his hat, but only a carrot appeared.
meanings.sent4: The detective managed to squeeze the truth out of the suspect during interrogation.
meanings.sent5: The chef demonstrated how to squeeze the garlic cloves to release their flavor.

meanings.sent1: The subway during rush hour felt like a tight squeeze.
meanings.sent2: The elevator was a squeeze with so many people trying to fit in.
meanings.sent3: The tiny room was a cozy squeeze for the family during the storm.
meanings.sent4: The concert hall was a squeeze with fans eager to see their favorite band.
meanings.sent5: The backpack was a tight squeeze in the overhead compartment of the plane.

meanings.definition: To force one's way through a narrow space
meanings.sent1: The cat tried to squeeze through the small gap in the fence.
meanings.sent2: He had to squeeze through the crowd to get to the front of the line.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous explorer managed to squeeze through the cave opening.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had to squeeze through the challenges to reach her goal.
meanings.sent5: The determined squirrel tried to squeeze through the bird feeder to get to the seeds.
